intro: Solanum vulgatum var. nigrum, commonly known as black nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial species that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that develop into globose, black berries when mature. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The berries are toxic when ripe but have been historically used in traditional medicine and culinary practices.
